title: United, Tallgrass, and Green Plains Form Joint Venture to Develop New Sustainable Aviation Fuel Technology Using ... - PR Newswire
summary: United Airlines, Tallgrass, and Green Plains Inc. announced a joint venture, Blue Blade Energy, to develop sustainable aviation fuel (SAF) technology using ethanol as feedstock. The venture aims to commercialize a pilot facility by 2024 and a full-scale facility by 2028, potentially producing up to 135 million gallons of SAF annually. The technology, based on non-petroleum feedstock, offers significant reductions in lifecycle greenhouse gas emissions.
green_innovation: TRUE - This joint venture focuses on developing a novel Sustainable Aviation Fuel (SAF) technology that aims to reduce carbon emissions in the airline industry, aligning with environmental sustainability goals and contributing to reducing negative environmental externalities.
business_innovation: TRUE - The article discusses the introduction of a new Sustainable Aviation Fuel (SAF) technology by a joint venture formed between United Airlines, Tallgrass, and Green Plains Inc., representing a significant new product innovation in the aviation industry.
green_product: FALSE - The article focuses on the development of a sustainable aviation fuel (SAF) technology utilizing ethanol as a feedstock, which is not a consumer product designed for daily use or consumption, but rather a fuel source for aviation purposes.
green_process: TRUE - The article describes the development of a green process for manufacturing sustainable aviation fuel (SAF) technology that aims to minimize environmental impacts, reduce waste, conserve resources, and decrease energy consumption in the aviation sector.
company: United Airlines, Tallgrass, and Green Plains Inc.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 325199 - All Other Basic Organic Chemical Manufacturing, 324199 - All Other Petroleum and Coal Products Manufacturing, 541710 - Research and Development in the Physical, Engineering, and Life Sciences., 325193 - Ethyl Alcohol Manufacturing
greenwashing: FALSE - The article provides detailed information about the Sustainable Aviation Fuel (SAF) technology developed by the joint venture, its potential environmental benefits, and collaboration with established entities, demonstrating transparency and substantive efforts toward environmental sustainability without misleading or deceptive claims.

title: Berlin’s green unicorn Enpal to get €215 million cash boost to supercharge its mission of creating a more sustainable ... - EU-Startups
summary: Enpal, a Berlin-based company, has secured €215 million in growth financing to further their mission of making clean energy affordable and accessible for every household. The company offers solar energy solutions to homes across Europe, aiming to accelerate the energy transition and reduce carbon emissions. Enpal has received support from high-profile investors and plans to expand its products and services to create a global renewable energy community.

title: Heat Pumps for Multifamily Homes - ACHR NEWS
summary: The article discusses the advancements in heat pump technology for multifamily homes, addressing challenges in convincing building owners to invest in high-efficiency HVAC systems through programs like Green Lease and IRA incentives. Various factors like project size, regional climate, application, and ownership influence the choice between VRF systems and mini splits. Initiatives like the Clean Heat for All Challenge in NYC promote the transition to more sustainable energy sources in multifamily buildings, emphasizing the importance of education for consumers and contractors.
